name: Markthalle Neun
title: New concept of food and shopping made fun
description: This charming market has many options to eat, you can find from delicious curry bursts to all different types of cheesse. Definitely this a place not to be missed.

name: The Barn
title: Coffee Roastery
description: Never have I ever tried such a great coffee, the taste without sugar is superb. We also tried the carrot cake, and it was a great delight. The only reason why I did not give them a 5 is because the chairs are not really confortable, I would have loved to spend the afternoon there.

name: Shiso Burger
title: Japanese style burgers
description: It may not have the best burger in town, but for some reason I keep coming back for more. All the burgers have a unique flavour, and the fries are to die for. One of the must-order burgers is the chilli lemon: a unique pleasure to your senses.

name: Cabslam - The California Breakfast Slam
title: Coffee Roastery
description: Are you hungry? This is the place to be. I was not really sure about what to expect, since I have lived in California and could not remember that there was a Californian type of breakfast. The result? Well, the food is plenty and delicious.

name: Kuchi
title: Japanese Sushi Bar
description: As a sushi lover, Kuchi was the official stop in Mitte. Fresh rolls that melt in your mouth, and delicious sashimi.

name: I Due Forni
title: Title
description: Pizza in this restaurant is amazing, you have a wide variety to choose from. The downside? It is always crowded, and might not be the most romantic place to enjoy a quite dinner. I would recommend the terrace outside and the dessert!

name: Sala Da Mangiare
title: Homemade Pasta in Neukolln
description:
Have you ever imagined what it would be dinning in the living room of an Italian friend, snob enough to look sophisticated and rustic enough to look friendly? This is how it feels to be sitting in Sala da Mangiare, a small corner of Neukölln fondly led by an Italian couple.
The menu is short but unequivocal, led by several types of their specialty, homemade pasta. The simple but high quality ingredients bring out the tender but al dente, strange and delicious to the palate accustomed to industrial pasta texture.
Reservations recommended as the place is small and the weekend is usually full. Being small, the environment can be noisy at rush hour, but when the audience starts to go into the night, the room reveals its romantic and warm side.
We liked the wine, and the homemade licorice liqueur was a surprise.
